intro: Cheiridopsis johannis-winkleri, commonly known as the Winkler's ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white, typically during the winter months. Its unique morphology and ability to thrive in harsh conditions make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
